snippet: Remains are still being unearthed from the killing of about 8,000 men and boys in 1995 in the worst atrocity committed in Europe since World War II.
abstract: Tragedy of 1995 Srebrenica Massacre of 8,000 Muslims continues with identification remains of 136 victims and Russian government veto of United Nations resolution calling act a crime of genocide.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and SOMINI SENGUPTA
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky reported from London, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Remains are still being unearthed from the killing of about 8,000 men and boys in 1995 in the worst atrocity committed in Europe since World War II.

headline.main: Srebrenica Massacre, After 20 Years, Still Casts a Long Shadow in Bosnia
headline.print_headline: Srebrenica Massacre Still Casts a Shadow on Bosnia

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
